clinical_study.brief_title: Kinematics and Kinetics of Gait Perturbations in Young Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Kinematics and Kinetics of Gait Perturbations in Young Healthy Adults
clinical_study.source: Józef Piłsudski University of Physical Education

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators would like to examine, what are strategies for balance recovery in gait perturbations. Different perturbation types where used in the current study. The study involves the analysis of kinematic and kinetic parameters. Researchers hypothesize that research including young healthy adults would help to elaborate fall prevention program for seniors.

primary_outcome.description: Joint angles calculated using HBM Gait model [degrees]
Joint moments calculated using HBM Gait model [Newton*meter/kilogram]
Ground reaction forces calculated using treadmill with built-in dual 6 DoF force plates and independent belts for each foot [Newtons]
Center of pressure calculated using treadmill with built-in dual 6 DoF force plates and independent belts for each foot [meters]
Body composition using Tanita Body Composition Monitor (fat tissue percentage, muscle mass percentage, water percentage)
Range of movement in hip, knee and ankle joint, measured using SFTR system [degrees]

intervention.description: Participants were subjected to four different perturbation types while walking on the treadmill: left treadmill belt deceleration for right leg toe off right treadmill belt deceleration for left leg toe off left treadmill belt acceleration for right leg heel strike right treadmill belt acceleration for left leg heel strike Motion analysis was conducted to analyze effect of the intervention on gait.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18-35
- female or male
- good health condition
Exclusion Criteria:
- lower limb injuries (last 6 months)
- head injuries (last 6 months)
- diseases of the vestibular system
- serious eye defects
- extreme sports athletes
